text: I have nothing against Jim Nantz, but I’m not sure what he adds to these Capital One commercials.

text: So in other words... a pretty average Friday.
author: ryanobles

text:
I was in NYC so @ForecasterEnten⁩ said “you wanna do a pod?” So we did a pod. 
It can only be so good w/o ⁦@RebeccaBuck⁩, but we did our best. 
We look at what the stats say about the launches of the 2020 candidates.
#TheForecast #Podwave
author: ryanobles

text: Oliver with a lesson here on your @Twitter settings.. better check to make sure you are getting the content you WANT to get.

text:
We broke down the latest 2020 news on "At This Hour". 
@JeffZeleny and @CillizzaCNN discuss a big new hire for Team @BetoORourke and the eternal @JoeBiden waiting game.

text:

text: Ha ha! Yes-- I agree on all counts.

text:
NEW: @BernieSanders will not attend AIPAC conference. Policy director @joshorton tells @CNN:
“Sen. Sanders has no plans to attend the AIPAC conference. He’s concerned about the platform AIPAC is providing for leaders who have expressed bigotry and oppose a two-state solution.”
author: ryanobles
ryanobles

text: You know we are in store for a good show when my tie is very similar to legendary floor director ⁦@BruceDunkins⁩. Tune in to @CNN at 11a ET for “At This Hour.”

text: Political advice aside... I think Ron's assessment of the value of this information is worth considering.
author: ryanobles

text:
NEW: @BetoORourke reveals to supporters in NH that he had 128k unique contributors for an average of $47 a person in the first 24 hours. 
By comparison- @BernieSanders had $5.9 million from 223k donors for an average of $27 a person in the first 24 hours. 
via/ @ericbradner
author: ryanobles

text: #Buffalove So cool! Let's Go Buffalo! #sabres
author: ryanobles

text: Read the piece please. There was more than one publication. We mention the Guardian response in the story.
author: ryanobles

text: H/t to @IsaacDovere who reported the timeline of Sirota’s hire first.. @GregJKrieg and I have some new nuggets in our piece on the staff additions.
author: ryanobles

text: Sirota was informally advising Sanders during the week of his official campaign launch- even traveling with the Sanders team from Brooklyn to Chicago for their opening week rallies.
author: ryanobles

text: Sirota’s hire comes as Sanders has vowed to run a respectable campaign and warned his surrogates against bullying and attacking their democratic opponents.
author: ryanobles

text: Sirota regularly hammered Democratic politicians- including many of Sanders’ opponents- on social media and in his writing. He scrubbed his social media of some 20k tweets in the past few days.
author: ryanobles

text: New @BernieSanders hire @davidsirota was announced today- but he was advising Sanders since the day after Sanders formally announced. He stopped working for publications on Feb 14th- but continued to describe himself as a “journo” while advising Sanders.
author: ryanobles

text:

Dem field:

Sanders: 20%
Harris: 12% ( 8%)
O’Rourke: 11%
Warren: 6%
author: ryanobles

text: On @CNN- @SenJackReed tells me the full Mueller report should be made public AND Mueller should come before the Congress to answer questions about what he learned.

text: MJ Lee is a fantastic reporter and we were blessed to have her on "At this Hour" today. Nothing strange (or starnage) about it.

text:
The ⁦@BernieSanders⁩ camp (which rarely publicly talks about their Dem opponents) acknowledges Beto’s big haul- but argues not all $6m fundraising efforts are the same.

Their pitch? Bernie has more individual donors.

text: The @BernieSanders campaign ready to plant their flag in California. He will travel their next week and hold rallies in San Diego on Friday and San Francisco on Sunday.

text: DJ- if you were having chicken wings and had to wrestle with the decision of ranch v blue cheese I’m not sure we can be friends. #friendsdontletfriendsputranchonchickenwings

text: Side note.. I was once represented by the UFCW when I loaded pallets at the distribution center for Quality Markets in Jamestown, NY. I’m pretty sure I paid my exit dues.
author: ryanobles

text: Pretty big move by the Sanders campaign. The first major presidential campaign to be unionized. The workforce will represented by the Union of Food and Commercial Workers.
author: ryanobles

text: The health care forum with @BernieSanders is underway. You can clearly see the bandage covering the Senator’s head. He got underway quickly with the panel and did not mention the accident.
author: ryanobles

text: He will still travel to Nevada tonight for a rally in Henderson scheduled for tomorrow.
author: ryanobles

text: The Senator’s schedule has not been  impacted by the minor accident. He had breakfast this morning with a group of local clergy and is set to hold a heath care round table here in Charleston in the next few minutes.
author: ryanobles

text: NEW: The @BernieSanders campaign just informed the press corp that the Senator cut his head on a glass shower door this morning. He went to a walk-in clinic, received 7 stitches and was given a “clean bill of health.” (more)
author: ryanobles
